meanings.definition: Allowing light to pass through diffusely.
meanings.sent1: The delicate petals had a translucent appearance.
meanings.sent2: The window glass was translucent, letting in soft light.
meanings.sent3: The ghost costume was so translucent that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a translucent quality, soothing and gentle.
meanings.sent5: The morning fog created a translucent veil over the meadow.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being translucent.
meanings.sent1: The translucence of the fabric allowed a hint of light to shine through.
meanings.sent2: The translucence of the water made it easy to see the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cloak shimmered with translucence, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he saw a deep translucence, revealing her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The translucence of the ice sculpture created a magical effect at the party.
